author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I'm assuming this package is for use in the MTH299 course at an institution. If so, I don't think it is a good fit for the general registry. The general registry is a shared resource for the whole Julia community, so it isn't great for the name MTH299Lite to refer to a specific institution's MTH299 course (e.g. why that institution and not a different institution's MTH299 course?)

I think it would be fine to register this package under the name CollegeOfStatenIslandMTH229Lite, though under the current General registry guidelines even that would not be allowed

> The General registry is not a place for "personal packages" that consist of collections of "utility functions" nor for packages that are only useful for a closed group (like a research group or a company). For that, it is easy to set up your own registry using for example LocalRegistry.jl. The Pkg documentation about registries might be useful if you decide to go this route.

https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General#should-i-register-my-package-now

Well, we registered `MTH229` many years ago with that name and this is intended to make it easier to use the features of that package on Binder, where registered packages are just easier to use. I suppose I could work around that, but would rather not.
Okay, working around not having this registered in binder isn't so troublesome. Feel free to close this registration request.

body:

title: New package: MTH229Lite v1.0.0
